subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Three Laws of Thought
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Three Laws of Thought.

hook.text: Aristotle proposed three laws so fundamental that all rational thought depends on them.

buildup.text: Identity: A is A. A thing is what it is. Sounds obvious, but without it, nothing can be defined.

discovery.text: Non-contradiction: A cannot be both A and not-A at the same time. Something can't be true and false.

twist.text: Excluded middle: A is either true or false ‚Äî no third option. Quantum physics later challenged this one.

climax.text: These three laws underpin every logical system, every legal code, and every scientific theory.

quiz.question: Which law states something cannot be true and false simultaneously?
